intro: Hymenothecium tenellum, commonly known as the slender hymenothecium, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
